5.61. 
Increase of shares in the succession
1. If the heir at law or the testator has not accepted the inheritance, or if the testator has deprived the heir of the right of inheritance, the share of the inheritance belonging to that heir shall go to the heirs at law and shall be divided among them in equal shares.
2. If the testator has bequeathed all his property by will to his designated heirs, the portion of the estate which belonged to the heir who has renounced or has not accepted the inheritance shall go to the other heirs under the will and shall be divided among them in equal shares.
3. The rules laid down in this Article shall not apply in cases where a secondary heir has been appointed to the heir who has renounced or has not accepted the succession.
